issue.title: Crash on linux wayland

labels.name: fix-committed
labels.description: Fix for the issue is in the main branch

repository.name: TrguiNG
repository.description: Remote GUI for Transmission torrent daemon

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Seems to happen only in flatpak or when xwayland is not available

Caused by update to tauri 1.5.4 which brought in tauri-runtime-wry 0.14.3

https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/8515

issue.title: fix(clipboard): build issues on wayland (fix #8515)

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
This PR added the `wayland-data-control` feature to the `clipboard` to avoid build issues on Wayland.

closes #8515.

<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(windows): fix race condition in event loop
    - docs: update docstrings
    - feat: add `Window::set_fullscreen`

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. If there is a related issue, reference it in the PR text, e.g. closes #123.
3. If this change requires a new version, then add a change file in `.changes` directory with the appropriate bump, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.changes/readme.md
4. Ensure that all your commits are signed https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits
5. Ensure `cargo test` and `cargo clippy` passes.
6. Propose your changes as a draft PR if your work is still in progress.
-->

body:
Why are crashes not prioritized? Another issue with tauri crashing has been open for months with 0 engagement
https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/7566

It does not look good if you don't care about issues that completely break apps built with your framework on supposedly supported platforms.

> Why are crashes not prioritized?

Full transparency: Because we're only 3 (active) devs with very very few outside contributions and we made the mistake to hype up mobile for v2 way too early and now with the audits ramping up we have to focus on getting the last big api changes done asap for the auditors...

Once tauri v2 is in a freeze for the audit we will focus more on bugs and docs, including v1 issues. We also hope that the huge refactors in v2 will make it easier for interested people to contribute. And we also have plans to make contributing a more guided experience and just easier, but that again needs time.

----

To talk about your specific issues here.

This one here has an open PR where we're waiting for the contributor to follow up on our feedback so we can merge it.

The one you linked is probably not as high of a prio as other breaking bugs because it's easy to work around by just not giving it an empty path (on the other hand this of course also means it would be easy to fix in Tauri so it's not a _good_ excuse).

----

I hope this clears it up a bit and believe me, we are at least as frustrated as you are :/

Thanks for the transparency.

Only thing I would add is for the future probably it would make sense to make some policy around being very cautious and defensive around unsafe code and use of `unwrap()` and such as that seems to be the common cause.

The unwrap part i totally agree with, the bare minimum would be to convert them to expect calls though of course, not panicking is better...
The unsafe code thing is tricky. It's unfortunately part of FFI heavy code bases like ours. We could maybe abstract it better but that probably wouldn't help with bugs like these, especially when it's not even happening in our own code but in a dependecy.
Any ETA on when this will be in v1 patch release?

issue.title: [bug] Panic in tauri-runtime-wry 0.14.4 during init on wayland in flatpak

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

This bug is continuation of #8515 it has different root cause but tauri code is still culpable in the crash.

After tauri v1.6 release I updated to it and now my app crashes on the same line but not on all wayland systems. Specifically it crashes on wayland composers that don't implement wlr_data_control_manager v1 protocol that the wl-clipboard-rs crate used by arboard relies on. When that protocol is not available it tries to fallback to x11 but in flatpak environment it is not available if the app already uses wayland so the clipboard fails to init, thus the app crashes with:
```
thread 'main' panicked at /run/build/TrguiNG/cargo/vendor/tauri-runtime-wry-0.14.4/src/lib.rs:2022:55:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Unknown { .. } - "Unknown error while interacting with the clipboard: $DISPLAY variable not set and no value was provided explicitly"
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```

### Reproduction

Try to run a tauri app bundled into a flatpak on a wayland composer without clipboard protocol support like Gnome.
I was able to repro this on default install of Fedora 39 workstation distro with my app: https://flathub.org/apps/org.openscopeproject.TrguiNG

### Expected behavior

App does not crash. If it can not use clipboard then those features should be unavailable but the app should still work.
I as a developer am prepared to add checks in my app code to handle this case if needed but currently tauri does not provide the api to do that, it just panics on init.

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
[] Environment
    - OS: Fedora 39.0.0 X64
     webkit2gtk-4.0: 2.42.5
     rsvg2: not installed
      Visit https://tauri.app/v1/guides/getting-started/prerequisites to learn more about tauri prerequisites
     rustc: 1.76.0 (07dca489a 2024-02-04) (Fedora 1.76.0-1.fc39)
     cargo: 1.76.0
     rustup: not installed!
      If you have rust installed some other way, we recommend uninstalling it
      then use rustup instead. Visit https://rustup.rs/
     Rust toolchain: couldn't be detected!
      Maybe you don't have rustup installed? if so, Visit https://rustup.rs/
    - node: 20.10.0
    - npm: 10.2.3

[-] Packages
    - tauri [RUST]: 1.6.0
    - tauri-build [RUST]: 1.5.1
    - wry [RUST]: 0.24.7
    - tao [RUST]: 0.16.7
    - @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 1.5.3
    - @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.5.10

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - distDir: ../dist

```
